intro: Baloskion tetraphyllum, commonly known as the four-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and the flowers are yellow with a distinctive ray floret structure. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
